comment._content: looks like the south beach to me

comment.author: 55347844@N04
comment._content: Agree with my pal shocko definitely the south beach

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: I think your "horse-power" vibe is safe Carol, that is too elegant an animal to be a cow.  Very interesting combination of transport, I was looking for the bicycle and then I realised that the early windsurfer was a cyclist trying out the wet sand.  I agree with shocko, it looks like the south beach to me.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
Ah, the simple joys of beachcombing  ...

... and riding a push-bike along the water's edge.

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/79549245@N06] Well done with the Citroen ID - I was going to suggest a Chevrolet,  which is quite wrong.

comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/33999943@N06] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/55347844@N04] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] South Beach it is then. Thank you all!  :)

comment._content: And yet another charming picture NLI, thank you for sharing.

comment.author: 62379908@N00
comment._content: Look at this one large.  I went up to 2000 pixels wide and found 14 people, a car, a motorcycle, a bicycle and a bird. Sharp  old pictures like that were made on really large negatives, which means that they often have great resolution.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/howard33] Yep, this one is from a glass plate negative, and they're spectacular quality. Can you put a note on the bird if you have a moment?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
